properties.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Casper Mountain
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 11:41AM MST until February 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Significant Blowing Snow Today across portions of Central
Wyoming...

...Winter Storm Watch for Far Western Wyoming Saturday Night
through Sunday night...

.A combination of strong wind and fresh snow will result in
considerable blowing and drifting of snow across southern Fremont
County into Natrona County this afternoon. A strong storm system
will likely bring significant snow across far western Wyoming
Saturday night through Sunday evening.

* WHAT...Areas of blowing and drifting of snow. Southwest wind of
25 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph. Wind Gusts of 60 to 65
mph are expected along Outer Drive in Casper, and on ridges
across southeast Fremont County.

* WHERE...Southern Fremont County and Natrona County. The worst
conditions will occur in western Natrona and southern Fremont
counties. The impacts from blowing snow right around Casper has
ended.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM.

* IMPACTS...Slippery roads and reduced visibility. The
combination of strong wind and slippery roads will increase
the chances of a vehicle sliding off the road.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected to occur
through early afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
